witnesses.relationship_to_accused: Former neighbor, assisted first husband in courtship

testimony.quarrel_subject: Disputes over children by first marriage, for which he was 'maimbour' (guardian)

witnesses.relationship_to_accused: Former neighbor for two years until last St. George

testimony.threat_quote: they had done ill, and would repent

timeline.subject: Mengette Estienne
timeline.details: Informations preparatoires against Mengette, wife of Colas Jean Gerard Estienne of Le Paire d'Avould, held and reputed to be a witch

timeline.subject: Mengette Estienne
timeline.details: Nicolas Remy as Procureur General de Lorraine orders interrogation and confrontation with witnesses

timeline.subject: Mengette Estienne
timeline.details: First interrogation - Mengette denies all charges and provides alternative explanations

timeline.subject: Mengette Estienne
timeline.details: Confrontations with witnesses - Mengette challenges witnesses and continues denials

timeline.subject: Mengette Estienne
timeline.details: Interrogation under torture - racking and 'corderelz', no confession obtained despite multiple sessions

timeline.subject: Mengette Estienne
timeline.details: Second day of torture at 7 a.m. - racked again without result, judges suggest devil protecting her

timeline.subject: Mengette Estienne
timeline.details: Nicolas Remy orders she be interrogated again under threat of torture; if she refuses to confess and no new evidence appears, she should be released with stern warnings

timeline.subject: Mengette Estienne
timeline.details: Change de Nancy approves Remy's order

timeline.subject: Mengette Estienne
timeline.details: Judges questioned her again with executioner pretending to prepare for torture, but in vain - she was released (renvoyée)

torture.requesting_official: Nicolas Remy, Procureur General de Lorraine

prior_accusations.context: Reputation originated when mother went to get fire from neighbor who had a man in bath with bad leg; diviner said one of neighbors caused it; rumor attached to mother because she had gotten fire, though never suspected before

notable_quotes.speaker: Mengette Estienne
notable_quotes.french: alarme, alarme, alarme, bon prince de Lorraine, je meurs, mon dieu mon Createur pitié misericorde
notable_quotes.english: alarm, alarm, alarm, good prince of Lorraine, I'm dying, my God my Creator pity mercy
notable_quotes.context: During torture by rack, crying out for help

notable_quotes.speaker: Mengette Estienne
notable_quotes.french: Vray Jhesus on luy faisoit grand tort Crians alarme alarme y at il plus de pitié au monde et qui nourriroit ses enfans
notable_quotes.english: True Jesus they were doing her great wrong, crying alarm alarm is there no more pity in the world and who would feed her children
notable_quotes.context: During torture, asserting her innocence and worry for children

notable_quotes.speaker: Mengette Estienne
notable_quotes.french: que non, et qu'elle mesme en a bien perdu, qu'il conviendroit bien mal que tous les inconvenients qui venoient fussent par des sorciers et sorcieres
notable_quotes.english: no, and that she herself had lost many [animals], it would be very wrong if all misfortunes that came were caused by witches and sorcerers
notable_quotes.context: Defense during interrogation - challenging the logic of witch accusations

notable_quotes.speaker: Mengette Estienne
notable_quotes.french: que le bruict leur fut donne mal à propos En ce qu'ung jour sa mere allant querir du feu chez ung de leur voisin
notable_quotes.english: that the rumor was wrongly given to them because one day her mother went to get fire from one of their neighbors
notable_quotes.context: Explaining origins of reputation - diviner blamed neighbor after mother borrowed fire from house with sick man

notable_quotes.speaker: Mengette Estienne
notable_quotes.french: qu'elle luy a tousjours porté hayne, pour ce qu'elle ne disoit vray. Mais pour cela ne luy a faict aulcung deplaisir, ny aà tous aultres
notable_quotes.english: that she always bore her hatred, because she did not tell the truth. But for that she had done her no harm, nor to any others
notable_quotes.context: About Catherine who called her 'genoxe' - asserting innocence

notable_quotes.speaker: Jean Connis (witness)
notable_quotes.french: que puis que sadite mere avoit usé de tels propos elle l'en hayroit toute sa vie, et toutte sa race
notable_quotes.english: that since his said mother had used such words she would hate her all her life, and all her race
notable_quotes.context: Mengette's threat after his mother opposed her marriage to Colin Collenel

notable_quotes.speaker: Colas Didier Noel (witness)
notable_quotes.french: luy qui depose assistant Colin Collenel premier marit à ladite Mengette à luy aller faire l'amour et venus qu'ils furent vers le pont de Cendroville ils ouyrent dire que c'estoit une sorciere
notable_quotes.english: he who testifies assisted Colin Collenel, first husband of said Mengette, in going to court her, and when they came to the bridge of Cendroville they heard said that she was a witch
notable_quotes.context: Witness recounting how he heard Mengette was reputed a witch over 20 years before, when helping her first husband court her

notable_quotes.speaker: Claude Bertremin Jacquemin (witness)
notable_quotes.french: Et y eust ung homme qu'on estimoit s'y fort bien cognoistre allentour qui leur fut visiter, qui leur declaira qu'elles estoient ensorcelées
notable_quotes.english: And there was a man who was thought to know very well about such things who came to visit them, who declared to them that they [the animals] were bewitched
notable_quotes.context: Expert visited and declared animals bewitched after property dispute with Mengette

economic_context.details: Multiple debt disputes: Nicolas Petit Didier pressing for payment of debts owed by Mengette's husband; Claude Jehandel stood guarantor for debt of about 9 francs for wheat purchase; witness 11 held 27 sheaves of wheat as pledge for debt. Property inheritance dispute with half-brother's family over first husband's mother's property. Field encroachment by husband as 'moictrier' (steward/agent). Economic impact of animal losses emphasized - witness 3 lost 240 francs worth of animals and nearly had to abandon his household.

weather_events: hailstorm allegedly caused by Mengette beating fountain water with white twig
economic_hardship_indicators: witness 3 nearly forced to abandon household due to animal losses worth 240 francs

prior_legal_disputes.description: Colin Jean Clement took Mengette's husband to justice over field encroachment, but they settled with compensation agreement
Multiple people called Mengette 'genoxe' and 'sorciere' but she never sought reparation
Colas Claude Demenge Ganay made reparation for calling her witch, otherwise her husband would have taken him before 'l'officier'

legal_context.redress_outcome: Never sought reparation despite being called witch publicly multiple times, which witnesses noted as suspicious

change_de_nancy.modification_details: Initially approved torture on September 26. After torture failed to produce confession, on October 13 approved Remy's order that she be released with stern warnings if she remained unwilling to confess and no new indices appeared

hearsay_chains.source: Poline, wife of Colas Claude Demenge Ganay
hearsay_chains.content: cows lost milk if they passed before her house
Mengette had passed among his herd remarking on fine beasts
she advised Colin Collenel against marriage with Mengette since she was reputed a witch
Mengette was a witch; saw her beat water with white twig to make rain when guarding animals
Mengette boasted she could make rain and beat water in fountain - hailstorm resulted

hearsay_chains.reporter: Marguitte femme à Claude le Parmentier
hearsay_chains.content: should not have taken back bachot; Mengette had been to house saying could feed piglet from plate
animals were ensorceled by someone of their parentage who taught them a counter-spell recipe

emotional_state_notes: Provided rational explanations (animals attracted to straw, husband's urine on doorpost)
Cried out dramatically during torture appealing to prince and God
Invoked concern for children during torture
Either fainted or became semi-conscious during torture ('a faict de la morte')
Maintained innocence throughout despite severe torture

reproaches_to_witnesses.objection: rumours were nothing but hearsay ('ung ouy dire, et que les ouy dire vont par ville')
denied harming animals; his calf 'mourut en pauvreté parce que les poulx le mangeoient' (died in poverty because fleas ate it)
he beat his mother and wife; wife told her he tried to strangle her; he was 'ung faussaire' (a liar)
he had made reparation for calling her witch; if not, her husband would have taken him before officer
vigorously denied rainmaking story; pointed out Claude Cuguin wouldn't have wanted her for 'baiselle' (sweetheart) if he thought her a witch
regarding wife's death, said he was joyful to live with other people now; wife was her friend and she cried when she died

extraction_metadata.notes: This is a remarkable survival case. Mengette withstood extensive torture (racking and thumb screws over multiple sessions on October 9-10) without confessing. She maintained her innocence throughout, providing rational explanations for accusations (animals attracted to fresh straw and husband's urine on doorpost). She challenged witness credibility and pointed out logical flaws in witchcraft accusations. Nicolas Remy ultimately ordered her release with stern warnings after no confession could be obtained. Her defense was notably sophisticated - she questioned why all misfortunes should be blamed on witches when she herself had lost animals. The case shows extensive testimony (22 witnesses) about reputation spanning 20-30 years, property and debt disputes, and the recurring motif of cows losing milk when passing her house. Economic context is crucial - debts, inheritance disputes, and substantial animal losses (240 francs for one witness). Notable that she never sought legal redress when publicly called witch, which witnesses found suspicious.
